fracas-problems.comment:
================================================================================ THE WIKIPEDIA SYLLOGISM PROBLEM SET ================================================================================
To be found at
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syllogism
Items with the suffix ":1" are from OCT-10 2007. Items with the suffix ":2" are from NOV-26 2009. Items without a suffix are the same in both versions. The only exception is item 007, where an obvious mistake was corrected.

problem.p: All the industrious boys in this school have red hair.
Some of the industrious boys in this school are boarders.
problem.h: Some boarders in this school have red hair.

problem.p: No jug in this cupboard is new.
All jugs in this cupboard are cracked.
problem.h: Some of the cracked items in this cupboard are not new.
Some green things are not edible.

problem.p: All apples in my garden are wholesome.
problem.h: Some ripe fruit is in my garden.

problem.p: All apples in my garden are wholesome.
problem.h: Some ripe fruit are apples in my garden.

problem.p: No scented flowers are grown indoors.
problem.h: No flowers grown indoors are coloured.

problem.p: All coloured flowers are scented flowers.
No scented flowers are grown indoors.
problem.h: No flowers grown indoors are coloured flowers.

problem.p: Some small birds live on honey.
All birds that live on honey are colourful.
Some small birds live on honey.
All birds that live on honey are colourful birds.
problem.h: Some colourful birds are small birds.
Some mythical creatures are not human.

problem.p: All perfect creatures are mythical creatures.
problem.h: Some mythical creatures are not human.

problem.p: No competent people are people who always make mistakes.
Some people who always make mistakes are people who work here.
problem.h: Some people who work here are not competent people.

fracas-problems.comment:
The "Syllogism" article refers to the following article on syllogistic fallacies:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syllogistic_fallacy
which, in turn refers to the following specific fallacies:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Affirmative_conclusion_from_a_negative_premise (1) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Existential_fallacy http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fallacy_of_exclusive_premises http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fallacy_of_the_undistributed_middle http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illicit_major http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illicit_minor (2) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fallacy_of_necessity
(1) was omitted because it gives no examples. (2) was omitted because it relates to a modal syllogism. Fallacies on "statistical" and "disjunctive" syllogisms were omitted because they do not fall within the syllogism proper.

problem.note: fallacy: affirmative conclusion from a negative premise
